metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7237 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cacti 1.2.8 allows Remote Code Execution (by privileged users) via shell metacharacters in the Performance Boost Debug Log field of poller_automation.php. OS commands are executed when a new poller cycle begins. The attacker must be authenticated, and must have access to modify the Performance Settings of the product.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 1.2.9+ds1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.9+ds1-1ubuntu1').
